  • comet.lib.storage.redis

Source code for comet.lib.storage.redis

"""
Implements a list-compatible object with redis backend
"""

import pickle
import logging

_logger = logging.getLogger("redis_storage")

import redis


###########################################

[docs]class BaseRedisList(object):
    def __init__(self, key, connection, expire, serializer, deserializer):
        _logger.debug("initialize MyList")
        self.serializer = serializer
        self.deserializer = deserializer
        self.expire = expire

        self.key = key
        self.r = connection


[docs]    def get(self):
        raw = self.r.get(self.key)
        return self.deserializer(raw) if raw else []


    def _get(self):
        raw = self.r.get(self.key)
        return self.deserializer(raw) if raw else []

    def _set(self, val):
        return self.r.set(self.key, self.serializer(val), ex=self.expire)

    def __iter__(self):
        _logger.debug("__iter__()")
        data = self._get()
        for elem in data:
            yield elem

    def __getitem__(self, key):
        data = self._get()
        return data.__getitem__(key)


[docs]    def clear(self):
        _logger.debug("clear()")
        return self._set([])



[docs]    def append(self, val):
        _logger.debug("append()")
        data = self._get()
        data.append(val)
        return self._set(data)


    def __len__(self):
        return len(self._get())



###########################################

[docs]class RedisList(BaseRedisList):
    def __init__(self, key, redis_config, expire=900,
                 serializer=pickle.dumps,
                 deserializer=pickle.loads):
        self.r = redis.Redis(**redis_config)
        super().__init__(key, self.r, expire, serializer, deserializer)



###########################################

[docs]class RedisKeyedList(object):
    def __init__(self, redis_config, expire=900,
                 serializer=pickle.dumps,
                 deserializer=pickle.loads):
        self.serializer = serializer
        self.deserializer = deserializer
        self.expire = expire

        self.r = redis.Redis(**redis_config)

    def __getitem__(self, key):
        return BaseRedisList(key, self.r, self.expire, self.serializer,
                             self.deserializer)

    def __setitem__(self, key, value):
        l = BaseRedisList(key, self.r, self.expire, self.serializer, self.deserializer)
        l._set(value)


[docs]    def get(self, key):
        return self.__getitem__(key)



###########################################

[docs]class RedisKeyed(object):
    def __init__(self, redis_config, expire=900,
                 serializer=pickle.dumps,
                 deserializer=pickle.loads):
        self.serializer = serializer
        self.deserializer = deserializer
        self.expire = expire

        self.r = redis.Redis(**redis_config)


[docs]    def get(self, key):
        raw = self.r.get(key)
        return self.deserializer(raw) if raw else None



[docs]    def set(self, key, val):
        return self.r.set(key, self.serializer(val), ex=self.expire)
